title: pessat through jee mains?
content:
when registering for PESSAT it gives a different option for JEE mains students saying " PESSAT (JEE Main candidates) " . given I have scored 98.5 percentile in my JEE main first attempt this year, what exactly is the procedure, do they make me write PESSAT or do I get in directly. I am also aware of the heightened fee. 
PS: I know I'm better off getting in through KCET or look elsewhere, I'm just asking out of curiosity.

comments.body: If I'm not wrong, you can get in NIT with 97/98+ percentile, go for NIT if you get in, instead of PES

I know I know, was just asking
( i don't think I'm going to get ece/cs in a decent NIT)
so what about pessat, am i supposed to write or do I get directly
You're suppose to right it register fast .
thanks I will , no issues tho, I'm writing KCET too and i expect to get in through that

There is a separate application to register through Jee mains.
PESSAT is not required.
is it an online application, can u link it
